Title.evidence: Pragmatic Ischaemic Thrombectomy Evaluation (PISTE) Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to receive IVT alone or IVT plus MT.

Participants.evidence: Eligible patients were adults with acute ischaemic stroke, confirmed large artery occlusion on CT angiography, and IVT initiated within 4.5 hours of symptom onset.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to receive IVT alone or IVT plus MT.

Objective.evidence: The PISTE trial evaluated the efficacy of adjunctive intra-arterial mechanical thrombectomy (MT) in addition to intravenous thrombolysis (IVT) in patients with acute ischaemic stroke due to large artery occlusion.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was independence at day 90, defined by a modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score of 0–2.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a minimisation algorithm.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixty-five patients were randomised between April 2013 and April 2015, with 32 receiving IVT alone and 33 receiving IVT plus MT.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In the intention-to-treat analysis, no significant difference was observed in the primary outcome.

Result_Outcome.evidence: no significant difference was observed in the primary outcome (adjusted OR 2.12, 95% CI 0.65 to 6.94, p=0.20).
